name: stenella-coeruleoalba
definition: The striped dolphin  is an extensively studied dolphin found in temperate and tropical waters of all the world's oceans.
description:
Like many other delphinids, striped dolphins have a fusiform body, tall dorsal fins, long, narrow flippers, and a prominent beak.

Striped dolphin exhibits a blue skin color with a white to light grey stripes, running along the spine.

The belly of the animal is lighter than sides.

This unique coloration distinguishes the animal from other dolphin species.

Anyway, the coloration of this animal may vary greatly depending on habitat and helping the dolphin easily merge with the environment.

As the dolphins age, the coloration and stripes on their body become more emphatic.

In some parts of their range, the Striped dolphins are occasionally called streakers due to their ability of moving very fast in order to avoid boats.

Striped dolphins inhabit both offshore and inshore areas, preferring warm-temperate and tropical waters.

The area of their distribution covers a huge territory, including the Atlantic Ocean, Pacific Ocean, Indian Ocean, Mediterranean Sea, Black Sea and the northern Gulf of Mexico.

These dolphins are opportunistic feeders, though they are primarily piscivorous and molluscivorous.

They generally prefer fish - especially lantern fish, cephalopods and crustaceans.

Striped dolphins natural predators include some sharks like tiger, dusky and bull sharks, and killer whales.

These dolphins are also often trapped in fishing nets.

Currently, very little is known about the mating system of striped dolphins, although is believed to be polygynous.

Females usually give birth every 4 years.

Gestation period lasts for 12 to 13 months.

Females and their young are known to form mothers-and-calf schools.

Newborn calves live in these groups with their mothers for 16 months, after which they are weaned.

When it comes the age, males of this species are usually able to mate within 7 to 15 years, whereas females are ready to mate at 5 to 13 years old.

Striped dolphins are highly social animals, known to gather in large schools, consisting of more than 1000 individuals.

However, they most commonly appear in smaller groups of 100 to 500 animals.

These active and playful animals are known to perform a variety of aerial maneuvers.

They can often be observed enthusiastically swimming along a vessel and accompanying the performance with twists and jumps.

Other maneuvers they perform include chin slaps as well as breaching or jumping out of water.

According to the IUCN Red List, the worldwide population size of the striped dolphin is over 2 million individuals.

Currently, striped dolphins are classified as Least Concern on the IUCN Red List.

trivia.caption: Striped dolphin family leaping synchronize at Pico island, Azores, Portugal.

related.definition: A marine mammal of temperate and tropical waters worldwide, having a short protruding beak, a gray or brown stocky body, and a prominent curved dorsal fin.
The harbour porpoise  is one of six species of porpoise.
The short-finned pilot whale is one of the two species of cetaceans in the genus Globicephala, which it shares with the long-finned pilot whale.
The killer whale or orca  is a toothed whale belonging to the oceanic dolphin family, of which it is the largest member.
The Indo-Pacific finless porpoise is one of seven porpoise species.
Cuvier's beaked whale is the most widely distributed of all the beaked whales.
